channel.title: Periodic refreshes are not happening
channel.description:
### Issue Summary
I am running Redash `10.1.0.b50633` on a kubernetes cluster. I didn't use helm, I did setup all the required deployments myself. Queries and stuff are working great. However, no matter what I tried I couldn't get periodic query refreshes running.
I have 4 other deployments, in addition to the server: 1. `adhoc-worker`
cmd=worker
``` QUEUES=queries WORKERS_COUNT=2 ```
2. `scheduled-worker`
cmd=worker
Environment variables:
``` QUEUES=scheduled_queries,schemas WORKERS_COUNT=1 ```
3. `scheduler`
cmd=scheduler
4. `worker`
cmd=worker
Environment variables:
``` QUEUES=periodic emails default WORKERS_COUNT=1 ```
And here are some screenshots from the admin:
![Screen Shot 2022-07-27 at 16.28.42|690x201](upload://xUm4olVMV7agH1T6afZkWPxFnZV.jpeg)
![Screen Shot 2022-07-27 at 16.28.12|690x233](upload://c7D5tpWwP34rHxroJXvpUGnOVSV.jpeg)
![Screen Shot 2022-07-27 at 16.28.17|690x244](upload://ixI6gRTJ8EtuY0j1HFfoO0101k9.png)
![Screen Shot 2022-07-27 at 16.28.31|690x151](upload://pIw5gVrcmqKcZ6aDdXIbcrI5MVo.jpeg)
What am I missing?
### Technical details:
* Redash Version: 10.1.0.b50633 * Browser/OS: * How did you install Redash:

item.dc:creator: jesse

Just as a suggestion, it might be easier to understand if the setting a refresh interval is disabled when the query has parameters.

Yeah full agree. Even better if we just enabled it to work and use the default value instead

Scheduling queries that use parameters is not currently supported.

Although it would be nice to see it communicated within the app

item.title: Periodic refreshes are not happening
item.dc:creator: th0th
item.description:
Turns out my queries were not refreshing because they had parameters in them. Once I added a query without a parameter, they started refreshing without issues. It would be a lot better if there is a note about it somewhere, I wouldn’t have spent many hours

Anyways, thanks for the help

Maintenance is not running Self Hosted Redash Support
Hmmm very strange not to see the registration, although it’s possible waiting longer may have shown a result. For consistency, I never run docker-compose up -d on its own to restart services. I run stop first, like this: $ docker-compose stop && docker-compose up -d This guarantees that everything stops and is restarted. I spent hours trying to debug, I think I did read through all the issues and forum messages that include the word “refresh”. I updated my workload yamls according to other people’s docker-compose.yamls, still no luck

And I can’t run dev_secheduler because I guess the thing that is used for watching the file changes is not available in the production docker image.

item.title: Periodic refreshes are not happening
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Since I can’t reproduce your issue, you’ll need to poke around a bit to see exactly what isn’t happening here.

Are you sure your query schedule is being saved? Does it persist between page reloads?
Is the scheduler service running? Do you see it enqueuing any jobs at all, such as schema refreshes (every 30 minutes)?

You can try changing the scheduler service cmd to dev_scheduler. And double, triple, quadruple check that it’s accessing the same Redis as your workers.

Read full topic

item.title: Periodic refreshes are not happening
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
The queue is created the first time it’s used. For example when you first load Redash it won’t even have a queries queue until you try executing your first query. See here. There is nothing special about a Queue in basic terms. It’s just a prefix to the Redis key which rq uses when handing jobs off to workers.

You can test this for yourself by connecting to the redis service and flushing all its keys:

docker-compose run --rm redis redis-cli -h redis

# then..

flushall

…then visit the System Status page and observe that all but the default queue disappeared.

From this we can presume the reason you don’t see a scheduled query queue is because the background execution does not occur.

Read full topic

item.title: Periodic refreshes are not happening
item.dc:creator: th0th
item.description:

item.title: Periodic refreshes are not happening
item.dc:creator: th0th
item.description:
I have single redis container, so all the workers and scheduler are using same redis instance. And the REDASH_REDIS_URL is coming from the same secret variable, so it shouldn’t be the issue.

  • This is a new instance, so I only have a single query with I use to test the refresh. Once I get it working, I can increase the number of workers.

  • Yes, I noticed the same thing. There isn’t a scheduled_queries queue, I don’t know why.

Here is the log for the scheduler container:

➜  redash kubectl logs -f deployment/scheduler -n redash
Starting RQ scheduler...
[2022-07-27 13:26:52,274][PID:1][INFO][rq_scheduler.scheduler] Registering birth

It just says “Registering birth” and nothing more.

Would it help if I share logs for REDASH_LOG_LEVEL=DEBUG?

Read full topic

item.title: Periodic refreshes are not happening
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
I don’t have an immediate answer for your. But a few observations and some questions:

  • Why is your scheduled_worker WORKERS_COUNT only 1? How many scheduled queries are you trying to execute?
  • I notice your RQ Status > Queues tab doesn’t even show a scheduled queue…

A common issue with k8s (which we don’t official support, yet) deployments is if you duplicated your redis pod. Redash is built to work on a single message queue. All other pods should point to the same redis, otherwise you’ll have side-effects just like this.

I wonder if your scheduler has been configured to with the right redis URI.

Do you see anything in your logs from the scheduler?

Read full topic

item.title: Periodic refreshes are not happening
item.dc:creator: th0th
item.description:
Issue Summary

I am running Redash 10.1.0.b50633 on a kubernetes cluster. I didn’t use helm, I did setup all the required deployments myself. Queries and stuff are working great. However, no matter what I tried I couldn’t get periodic query refreshes running.

I have 4 other deployments, in addition to the server:

  1. adhoc-worker

    cmd=worker

    QUEUES=queries
WORKERS_COUNT=2

  2. scheduled-worker

    cmd=worker

    Environment variables:

    QUEUES=scheduled_queries,schemas
WORKERS_COUNT=1

  3. scheduler

    cmd=scheduler

  4. worker

    cmd=worker

    Environment variables:

    QUEUES=periodic emails default
WORKERS_COUNT=1

And here are some screenshots from the admin:

What am I missing?

Technical details:

  • Redash Version: 10.1.0.b50633
